summary: The text discusses the downfall and destruction of Jerusalem by the Romans, as foretold by Jesus weeping over the city in the Gospels. The Jewish people, despite experiencing the desolation of their homeland and temple, did not call upon the Lord during the Roman siege but relied on arms. This led to their punishment due to their rejection of the Lord, making their calls for help futile. The text highlights the apocalyptic tone of the events and the failure of the Jews to recognize their transgressions.
